summary: This document consists of email exchanges between individuals at USANYS (likely the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York) and a contractor regarding scheduling a call to discuss scanning data to be loaded into Relativity for the case US v. Epstein. It reveals ongoing case management activities in March 2021.

events.title: Scheduled call about Epstein case data
events.description: Email exchanges to schedule a call for 4:30 PM to discuss scanning data for the US v. Epstein case to be loaded into the Relativity platform.

keyFacts: The document is a series of emails dated March 25, 2021, concerning the case US v. Epstein.
The correspondence involves personnel from USANYS (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York) and a contractor.
The subject is scheduling a call to discuss technical details about loading scanning data into the Relativity e-discovery platform for the case.
The emails indicate ongoing case management and evidence processing activities related to the Epstein investigation in 2021.
All personal names and specific email addresses in the document are redacted.
